bibl.title: Syene (Ancient Aswan) in the First Millenium AD.
bibl.note: Location and limits of Roman and Late Antique Syene [The town walls; - The northern and western limits of the town; - The size of Roman and Late Antique Aswan; - The Patermouthis archive and the southern limits of Syene]. - Neighbourhoods of Roman and Late Antique Syene [The Phrourion: Areas 1 and 2; - A Ptolemaic and early Roman burial ground for animals (Area 2); - The beginnings of the Roman town quarter (Areas 2 and 1); - The centre of the Roman town (Areas 6, 9, 15 and 52)]. - Conclusion.

bibl.title: Egypt in the First Millennium AD. Perspectives from New Fieldwork

bibl.seg: Wolfgang Müller, Syene (Ancient Aswan) in the First Millenium AD.

Elisabeth R. O'Connell (ed.), Egypt in the First Millennium AD. Perspectives from New Fieldwork = British Museum Publications on Egypt and Sudan. 2 (Leuven - Paris - Walpole, MA, 2014) pp. 59-69, 1 fig. et pll. 1-14.

Location and limits of Roman and Late Antique Syene [The town walls; - The northern and western limits of the town; - The size of Roman and Late Antique Aswan; - The Patermouthis archive and the southern limits of Syene]. - Neighbourhoods of Roman and Late Antique Syene [The Phrourion: Areas 1 and 2; - A Ptolemaic and early Roman burial ground for animals (Area 2); - The beginnings of the Roman town quarter (Areas 2 and 1); - The centre of the Roman town (Areas 6, 9, 15 and 52)]. - Conclusion.
